docs.lead_paragraph: SCHENECTADY, Sept. 23. -- Local Socialists were surprised to-day by the resignation of Ben S. Henry as business manager of Mayor George R Lunn's paper, The Citizen, and his further repudiation of the Principles of the Socialist Party, of which he has been a member almost as long as Dr. Lunn himself.

headline.main: ANOTHER SOCIALIST QUITS MAYOR LUNN; Gives Up Socialism, Too, and Declares It Has Failed in Schenectady.

docs.abstract: B S Henry, Socialist business mgr of Lunn's paper The Citizen, quits, renounces Socialist Party; says he is disappointed with Lunn adm of affairs; other Socialist resignations noted

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: ABOUT the most difficult place in New York to effect entrance without castiron credentials and patents of good faith is the almshouse.

headline.main: MAKING THE WEALTHY CARE FOR THEIR NEEDY RELATIVES; Supt. Bauer of the Children's Bureau Describes How Some Well-to-do People Shirk Their Duty as Parents and Grandparents.
